featured.text: This group of islands off the coast of Ecuador has recently contracted Argentine Corporación America to manage the redevelopment of the airport on the island of Baltra.
More recently, the parks have received several international honors.
For US $60, a recently-founded company called Dognition will help you learn more about your dog’s cognitive traits.
Recently, new models have been introduced and accessories added to meet the needs of laborers working on various job sites.
Up until recently, the only way for a Maasai boy to achieve warrior status was to single-handedly kill a lion with his spear.

other.text: Recently a health survey was carried out in Taiwan to determine _________.
A 54-page manuscript written by Albert Einstein recently was sold for $398,500 at Christie’s in New York.
A team of scientists, teachers, and students, the AmazonQuest team, recently explored some of the wonders of the Amazon Rainforest.
His 1848 novel, The Man in the Iron Mask, was recently made into a movie.
Luckily for his fans, the mansion has recently been restored and opened to the public.
Researchers at Purdue University recently concluded that a compound in green tea 17 the growth of cancer cells.
In the news recently was the story of a woman who died of a heart attack while driving her station wagon.
Recently in Taiwan, the manufacturing industry has ________
Hseu Fang-yi, a young Taiwanese dancer, recently _____ at Lincoln Center in New York and won a great deal of praise.
Recently, however, the International Olive Council (IOC) is seeking input on test methods to improve the transparency of the testing process and boost the accuracy of the results.

definition.en_def: In the near past; not long ago.
definition.example: I recently finished reading a great book.
